Sci-fi horror based on the novel by Juan de Dios Garduno, starring Matthew Fox and Jeffrey Donovan

programme.title: Medical Detectives

programme.title: Hatton Garden: The Inside Story
programme.desc: Ross Kemp examines the April 2015 heist in London's diamond district, when a group of career criminals broke into a safe deposit facility and stole approximately 14million in precious metals, cash and jewels, an event dubbed the biggest burglary of its type in British history. The documentary gains access to the secret surveillance material that put the thieves behind bars and features exclusive interviews with the detectives who cracked the case as well as Kenny Collins, one of the thieves involved

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The case of renowned Alaskan gold miner and outspoken political activist Joe Vogler, who vanished from his remote Fairbanks home in 1993. Police found his residence undisturbed with no evidence of foul play, but his allies refused to give up their search, forcing authorities to consider such theories as murder, a government conspiracy or even alien abduction

programme.title: Hatton Garden: The Inside Story
programme.desc: Ross Kemp examines the April 2015 heist in London's diamond district, when a group of career criminals broke into a safe deposit facility and stole approximately 14million in precious metals, cash and jewels, an event dubbed the biggest burglary of its type in British history. programme.desc: The first of two compilations of highlights from the recent series. Among the guests featured are Taylor Swift, Daniel Craig, Eddie Redmayne, Lashana Lynch, Bono, Kate Hudson, Ian McKellen, Paul Mescal, Geena Davis, Stormzy, Lesley Manville, Colin Farrell and Bruce Springsteen

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Katherine Ryan, Harry Pinero, Rev Richard Coles, Scott Mills, Mark Wright, Judi Love and Philippa Perry

programme.title: Live NBA
programme.desc: Boston Celtics v Brooklyn Nets (Tip-off 12.30am). All the action from the Eastern Conference encounter at TD Garden

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Poppy O'Toole and Bryn Williams, plus special guest Alesha Dixon. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain provides the inspiration to bring the joy of baking into everyday lives, and celebrates bakers across Britain, shining a light on their favourite bakes. She begins with treats for an easy Afternoon Tea, from striped meringue lollipops to coffee cake with dalgona coffee cream and dreamy butterscotch cheesecake bars, and meets Mina Said-Allsopp, who shares her secrets to a gluten-free chocolate sourdough

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Liverpool v Manchester United. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Manchester City and Newcastle United

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Catherine Southon help two teams scour Exeter's Westpoint Arena for items, while host Natasha Raskin Sharp finds out about the ancient skill of enamelling

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a couple from London with a 550,000 budget to make a rural move to Wiltshire, and joins a group of bicycling enthusiasts on a ride through Longleat Estate

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the second session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The women's pole vault final gets under way and the men's heptathlon continues with the high jump. The women's 800m semi-finals also take place, with Great Britain's Keely Hodgkinson the reigning champion. With analysis by Jessica Ennis-Hill and Denise Lewis, and commentary from Steve Cram and Andrew Cotter

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the celebrity version of the classic quiz. Yvette Fielding, Helen McGinn, Matt Richardson and Sarah Keith-Lucas are in the famous black chair, answering questions on Morecambe & Wise, The Hollywood novels of Jackie Collins, Concorde, and the film Labyrinth

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, which sees former England rugby star Ugo Monye, tennis player Judy Murray, goalkeeper David James and Scottish footballer Pat Nevin taking it in turns to cross the floor by only stepping on the correct answers - and doing their best to avoid the wrong ones. For the final crossing, those who have been successful join forces for a chance to take home the money for their chosen charities

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian returns with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Motsi Mabuse, Jon Richardson, Tom Skinner, Carol Vorderman, Joe Marler, Rav Wilding and Joanne McNally

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman host a news-themed episode of the celebrity quiz. Cathy Newman, Keme Nzerem, Lucrezia Millarini, Nina Nannar, Mike Bushell, Kasia Madera, Jennie Bond, Nicholas Owen pair up to come up with the answers that no one else could think of

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jacob struggles to gain the respect he needs from his department, and feels that Robyn is not putting in the effort she needs to. Stevie is haunted by Marcus' abuse, but Faith helps her to both move forward and see that he suffers some consequences for his crimes. Rash is left struggling with his Dad's welfare after his carer is attacked

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Newcastle United at Etihad Stadium and Arsenal v Bournemouth at Emirates Stadium. The Citizens and Newcastle shared the spoils in a thrilling 3-3 draw at St James' Park in August, but the champions will have hoped to make home advantage count this time around. Arsenal are battling City for the title, and will have expected a second win of the season against the Cherries. Plus, Aston Villa v Crystal Palace, Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United, Chelsea v Leeds United, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Tottenham Hotspur and Southampton v Leicester City

programme.title: Going in Style (2017)
programme.desc: Joe Harding, Willie Davis and Albert Garner are lifelong friends who have been swindled out of their pension money by a Brooklyn bank. So the seasoned pals decide to steal their cash back in a daring robbery. Director Zach Braff's remake of George Burns's 1979 heist caper, starring Morgan Freeman, Michael Caine and Alan Arkin

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita and Mark head to East Anglia to shop for antiques. While Irita finds some overlooked rare Hungarian porcelain, Mark indulges his taste for mid-century design

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about a gatehouse riddled with Civil War bullets, a unique Iron Age shield made from bark, and Roman burials with pots where the heads should be

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: Baby hippo Mafuta is in crisis. His pod has been taken over by a marauding male and his mother must take him far away from the river. Kali the lioness tries to dig the warthogs out of the den, but there's an unexpected twist when the rest of the pride gets involved. As the land dries, the lake becomes a place of refuge for the thirsty herds - but as things go from bad to worse, Bakari leads the baboons in search of better foraging, while Nalla and the elephants set off in search of water

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: Holding Back the Years
programme.desc: With the NHS apparently moving towards rationing more surgery for chronic conditions, Fiona Phillips and Dr Rangan Chatterjee ask whether having an operation is a person's right. The programme also catches up with the OAP hoarders who are being threatened with eviction and sees what lessons can be learned Japan, which has the longest life expectancy in the world

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of day one from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. Heats take place in the men's and women's 800m, women's 3,000m and men's 1500m. In the field, there is qualifying for the men's and women's shot put, women's high jump and men's triple jump

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nihal Arthanayake, Jake Humphrey, Patsy Kensit and Mae Martin test their skills in a variety of trivia-based games, with the ultimate winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nihal Arthanayake, Jake Humphrey, Patsy Kensit and Mae Martin go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games for the final time, prior to the week's overall winner being declared

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from Scotland must go head-to-head and cook their six-course menus again. They serve their dishes to the panel of judges, Tom Kerridge, Nisha Katona, Ed Gamble, and celebrated Scottish comic book artist Frank Quitely. Andi Oliver hosts

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary examining the May 1985 bombing of Greenpeace ship Rainbow Warrior, a symbol of peace that had just returned from a visit to the Marshall Islands in the Pacific Ocean, where the inhabitants were suffering the effects of nuclear fallout following the 1954 testing of American H-bomb Bravo. After travelling south to Auckland harbour, New Zealand, two explosions sank the ship and killed a crew member

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: The hapless heroine examines fatbergs, explainng why there is nothing more shameful for society than their existence. Comedy short, written, directed by and starring Diane Morgan

programme.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
programme.desc: Tom Allen interviews the show's freshly rejected candidate, who reveals what it is really like to be in the firing line. Studio guests also discuss their views on what has happened in this week's episode

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Slammed: The Seventies
programme.desc: Documentary focusing on the Wales rugby union team in the 1970s. The national rugby team has lost its sparkle and the Welsh Rugby Union puts its faith in a group of talented young players, but with the best team in the world coming to Wales, a radical decision changes their fortunes

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Documentary following doctors and surgeons working for Leeds Hospitals Trust as they decide who to treat next on their ever-increasing waiting lists. At Leeds General Infirmary, Professor Simon Kay stands ready to perform a rare double hand transplant, while in neurosurgery Kenan Deniz has two patients needing urgent brain operations

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: The Addenbrooke's trauma surgeons take two patients from resus to the operating theatre to give them life-saving treatment. The first is 55-year-old Carolyn, who has been involved in a road traffic accident. Despite a cerebral bleed, her most critical injuries are to her pelvis and her heel, which has an open fracture. Meanwhile, 75-year-old Joan has been knocked over by a van, leaving her with multiple injuries. The main question is whether her foot, which has lost a lot of skin, can be saved

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville report on the heartbreaking case of the woman faced with a large medical bill which her travel insurer will not cover

programme.desc: Live coverage of the morning session on day two from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The women's pentathlon gets under way with the 60m hurdles, high jump and shot put. There is also qualifying for the men's long jump and women's pole vault and triple jump, and heats in the men and women's 400m and the women's 1500m and 60m

programme.title: Best Bakes Ever
programme.desc: In light of Britain's baking obsession, actress and cake expert Jane Asher presents a selection of recipes from television chefs, including James Martin, Mary Berry, Paul Hollywood, the Hairy Bikers, Raymond Blanc, Nigella Lawson, Tom Kerridge, Lorraine Pascale and Rachel Khoo

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of the second session on day two from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The women's pentathlon concludes with the long jump and 800m, and medals will also be decided in the men's shot put, triple jump and 1500m, and women's 3,000m, shot put and 60m

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Part two of two. Liz Bonnin joins the palaeontologists as they unearth the remains of fearsome Jurassic predators, with the team considering if the site was a dinosaur hunting ground. They try to figure out if these predators were involved in the deaths of supersized beasts like the diplodocus buried at the site, helping to reveal why so many dinosaurs came here, and what killed them in such great numbers 150 million years ago

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before - loofahs. Joe Swift visits a garden where the contemporary and traditional meet. And Advolly Richmond discovers a stunning Japanese-inspired garden

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: More of the best moments from the 'T' series, hosted by Sandi Toksvig, featuring regular panellist Alan Davies

programme.title: Cunk on Shakespeare
programme.desc: Charlie Brooker's Weekly Wipe star Philomena Cunk presents a comedic documentary about William Shakespeare, despite knowing absolutely nothing about him. She leaves no stone unturned as she gets to the bottom of the Bard, visiting his birthplace, exploring the Globe, and studying priceless artefacts. The commentator also interviews six different experts, including renowned actor Simon Russell Beale, Educating Yorkshire teacher Matthew Burton, and Shakespearean scholar Professor Stanley Wells

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Tom Allen is the host for the first in a new run of stand-up showcases, performed in front of a live audience at London's world-famous Hammersmith Apollo. Each show features sets from two of the country's most acclaimed up-and-coming comedians, and this week it is Rosie Jones and Kae Kurd taking to the stage. Performers set to appear in this series include Sindhu Vee, Alex Edelman, Lou Sanders, Darren Harriott, Jessica Fostekew, Stephen Bailey, Desiree Burch, Paul McCaffrey, Jonny Pelham, Ardal O'Hanlon, Sara Barron, Mawaan Rizwan, Guz Khan, Kiri Pritchard-McLean, Rhys James, Sarah Pascoe, Chris McCausland and Flo & Joan

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Katie Razzall

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Josh reveals a childhood experience that echoes his relationship with Molly, Cyn and Yaya's trip brings them closer, and Orna helps Ping face her self-destructive instincts

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Yaya's recent confidence boost reawakens Cyn's interest. A burst of intimacy causes Molly to question how long this happy moment with Josh can last

programme.title: Pain and Glory (2019)
programme.desc: A film director in physical decline re-encounters or remembers key elements of his past, from his childhood in a small village to his first love in 1980s Madrid. In recovering his past, he develops an urgent need to recount it, and also finds his salvation. Pedro Almodovar's drama, starring Antonio Banderas and Asier Etxeandia. In Spanish

programme.title: The Human Voice (2020)
programme.desc: A woman waiting for her ex-lover to collect his suitcases from her flat gets one last chance to speak to him over the phone, while the couple's dog watches, unable to comprehend that his master has abandoned them. Pedro Almodvar's short film based on Jean Cocteau's play, starring Tilda Swinton

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Crisis pregnancy advice centres are supposed to help women with unplanned pregnancies, but an investigation reveals evidence that some clinics, operating outside the NHS, are giving misleading information and offering counselling that could persuade women not to have abortions. Reporter Divya Talwar also uncovers links between some UK centres and the anti-abortion movement in America

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Copies of a pornographic pamphlet circulate Versailles depicting Chartres as the Queen's lover and father to the unborn child, cuckolding the King. Louis locks down the chteau, and Antoinette's many enemies are questioned. Yolande vies against Lamballe to be closest to the troubled ruler

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: Fearing an outbreak of scurvy, the crew stops in St Augustine, where the search for citrus leads to a run-in with a major figure from Jim's past. Meanwhile, after learning that Blackbeard is ready to move on to his next adventure, Stede forces his pirate friend and Lucius on a treasure hunt. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Rhys Darby

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of the morning session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The men's heptathlon continues with the 60m, long jump and shot put, and the men's 60m heats also take place

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of the morning session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The men's heptathlon continues with the 60m, long jump and shot put, and the men's 60m heats also take place

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall's global journey culminates in a visit to Antarctica, the land of extremes. The presenter tackles freezing conditions to explore the underwater world of an iceberg, has an encounter with a group of humpback whales, and fulfils a lifelong ambition by diving with one of the greatest predators to inhabit the waters - the leopard seal

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: As the drought ends and the land returns to its former beauty, newborn giraffe Twiga takes his tentative first steps, trying to control his gangly legs - and he must learn quickly as lioness Kali is on the prowl. Another baby enters the elephant herd, and shortly after the newborn's father appears to greet his son in an awe-inspiring moment. Mafuta and the rest of the hippos return to the river, only to find the crocodiles have laid claim to the riverbank - so the hippos try to evict their old enemies

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The Wyoming Wetlands Society is a non-profit organisation that relocates beavers that have been damaging expensive landscaped areas and flooding yards and roads with their dam-building activities in Teton County. This documentary follows the work of Drew Reed as he traps the problem animals and takes them to drainage areas of the Gros Ventre River, where the beavers help to restore and enhance wetland habitats, providing many direct and indirect benefits to both wildlife and people. Rob Brydon narrates

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets his good friend, the actor and comedian Barry Humphries, who fell in love with Cornwall in the 1960s when he escaped London to develop his famous character Dame Edna Everage. Barry talks about his friendship with British poet John Betjeman, and asks Rick to review his home-made fishcakes. Rick also goes fishing for crab, before cooking a simple yet delicious crab omelette. The host then takes a dip in the chilly north Atlantic with an eccentric group of wild water swimmers called the Perranporth Blue Tits

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman hosts a star-studded version of the culinary contest, which sees Mary Berry, Chris Bavin and Angela Hartnett judging 10 famous cooks. Taking part are Ferne McCann, Gareth Thomas, Desiree Burch, Ed Balls, Karim Zeroual, Ruth Madeley, Tom Read Wilson, Shobna Gulati, Ed Byrne and Rachel Johnson. In this first edition, Mary wants to know what home cooking means to the contestants, so she challenges them to produce their ultimate home-cooked dinner

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms revisits some of the great British war films that helped boost the nation's morale in the difficult years that followed the end of the Second World War. Among the silver screen gems highlighted are In Which We Serve, Reach for the Sky, Bridge on the River Kwai and The Dam Busters. The programme includes archive interviews with stars including Noel Coward, Richard Attenborough, David Lean, Alec Guinness, Kenneth More and John Mills, and Sylvia shares her memories of filming her own contribution to the genre, Ice Cold in Alex

programme.title: The Eagle Has Landed (1976)
programme.desc: A Nazi secret agent plans to kidnap Winston Churchill while the prime minister spends a weekend in the Norfolk countryside, and plants covert operatives in the area ready for his arrival. Second World War adventure, adapted from Jack Higgins' novel, starring Michael Caine, Donald Sutherland, Robert Duvall, Jenny Agutter, Donald Pleasence, Anthony Quayle and Jean Marsh

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further live coverage of the second session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. Medals are decided in the women's triple jump, 1500m and 400m and the men's 400m and 600m. Reigning Olympic 100m champion Marcell Jacobs of Italy claimed an emphatic victory over 60m when the event was last held two years ago in Poland. With analysis by Jessica Ennis-Hill and Denise Lewis, and commentary from Steve Cram and Andrew Cotter

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Comedian Lucy Porter and Chaser Jenny Ryan visit antique shops in south Wales. On hand to help are experts Serhat Ahmet and Steven Moore. An alcohol-themed spending spree sees both celebrity trippers purchasing items once used for marketing boozy products. However, they buy classy objects too, including something originating from Buckingham Palace and some quite pricy oak library steps

programme.title: Universe
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox explores the Milky Way, using data from a cutting-edge space telescope to reveal the dramatic history of Earth's galaxy, and predict its cataclysmic future. The European Space Agency's Gaia Space Telescope painstakingly measures the true position of over a billion stars, producing the most accurate map of the Milky Way ever created, while also measuring their movement, allowing their positions to be tracked back through time

programme.title: Dionne Warwick - Don't Make Me Over
programme.desc: Profile of the singer whose career has spanned more than four decades with hits such as Alfie, Walk On By and That's What Friends Are For. Featuring contributions from friends, family and collaborators including Burt Bacharach, Tom Jones, Gloria Estefan, Quincy Jones and Michael Caine

programme.title: Dionne Warwick at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of performances on BBC programmes by the singer, featuring Heartbreaker, Always Something There to Remind Me, Anyone Who Had a Heart, All the Love in the World, and That's What Friends Are For with Elton John

programme.title: Fern Britton Meets
programme.desc: The singer looks back on her 50-year career, which began with the release in 1962 of her first single Don't Make Me Over and has most recently seen her re-record some of her best-known hits. The entertainer also discusses the death of her cousin Whitney Houston earlier this year, fighting racism, and the importance of her Christian faith

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The Baron awakens from his deathly slumber, and demands the other vampires show him the wonders of life in the New World - so the housemates treat him to a night out in Manhattan. Supernatural sitcom, starring Kayvan Novak, Matt Berry and Natasia Demetriou

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The housemates awaken to an unexpected crisis with no memory of how it happened, and find themselves put on trial by an international tribunal of vampires. Tilda Swinton heads up a star-studded guest cast, including Dave Bautista (Guardians of the Galaxy), Kristen Schaal (Flight of the Conchords), Danny Trejo (Machete), Wesley Snipes (Blade), Evan Rachel Wood (True Blood), and the stars of the original movie, Taika Waititi, Jemaine Clement and Jonny Brugh, reprising their roles

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: Nadja gives Jenna an introduction to life as a vampire and trains her how to take her first victim, while Nandor applies for American citizenship

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: Tensions run high as the housemates prepare to host the Biannual Vampire Orgy - and Guillermo fears that an old friend of his will end up being killed during the party. Comedy, starring Matt Berry, Kayvan Novak, and Natasia Demetriou

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: Nandor pays a visit to one of his living descendants, while Nadja is reunited with her continually reincarnated lover Gregor, still in the guise of nightwatchman Jeff. Comedy, starring Matt Berry, Kayvan Novak, and Natasia Demetriou

programme.title: Tove (2020)
programme.desc: Biopic of writer and artist Tove Jansson, following her newfound creative and personal freedom in the wake of the Second World War. As the Moomin stories evolve from the tales she used to tell children in the bomb shelters, she is torn between her love for a theatre director and her open relationship with a married politician. Starring Alma Poysti and Krista Kosonen. In Swedish, Finnish, English and French

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In picturesque Snowdonia, Michael Portillo braves the fastest zip line in the world - stretching 1,500 feet across a vast slate quarry as he begins the last leg of his journey to Caernarfon. En route, he also visits the home of British mountaineering, Pen y Gwryd, to hear how an Edwardian journalist and poet created a climbing community, which grew to include men who would conquer Everest in the 1950s

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson reveals how some of the nation's best-loved villages played a vital part in significant moments of history. He begins in Bamburgh in Northumberland, explaining how the health and fortunes of the village were shaped by those in charge of its famous castle, from early English kings to 18th-century philanthropists, who pioneered a welfare system nearly 200 years before one existed nationally. Ben visits fellow archaeologist Jessica Turner, whose findings show the seventh-century residents of Bamburgh were robust and healthy - contrary to the usual malnourishment of the British medieval population

programme.title: Chariots of Fire (1981)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning drama based on the true story of British runners Eric Liddell and Harold Abrahams, going for gold at the 1924 Olympics in Paris. The two athletes are driven by very different impulses - Liddell is inspired by his devout Christian faith, while Abrahams hopes to triumph over the anti-Semitism he has endured all his life. Starring Ian Charleson, Ben Cross, Nigel Havers, John Gielgud and Ian Holm. Vangelis provides the soundtrack

programme.title: Rain Man (1988)
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

programme.title: Hans Zimmer: Hollywood Rebel
programme.desc: Profile of the Oscar-winning composer responsible for some of the best-loved film and TV scores of the past few decades. Contributors include directors Christopher Nolan, Denis Villeneuve, and Steve McQueen. In this portrait, Zimmer reveals the musical secrets of his craft - how he goes about terrifying, moving and raising people's spirits through his work

programme.title: Peaky Blinders
programme.desc: Tommy sets out to change the face of Birmingham's Chinatown, and seeks to use donations to the church to guarantee a path of reconciliation for his brother Arthur. Back in the Garrison Tavern, he makes an introduction that promises to change his family forever, and on a barge in Solihull, he has an encounter that could jeopardise his own marriage

programme.title: Peaky Blinders
programme.desc: 1933 brings both opportunities and dangers to the Peaky Blinders. As the clouds of the coming storm gather, Tommy is beset by demons old and new, and must face the consequences of his experiences and his actions to deal with a world on the road to war. Final episode of the period gangster drama, starring Cillian Murphy, with Tom Hardy reprising his role from the show's second series

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Meat Loaf presents and performs on the chart show from April 14, 1994, also featuring Terrorvision, Reel 2 Real with the Mad Stuntman, Pet Shop Boys, Frances Ruffelle, Loveland vs Darlene Lewis, Garth Brooks, Toni Braxton and Take That

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier presents the chart show from April 21, 1994, featuring Crash Test Dummies, Bitty McLean, CJ Lewis, the Pretenders, Erasure, Crystal Waters, Deacon Blue, Toni Di Bart and Prince

programme.title: St David's Day at the BBC
programme.desc: A rummage through the BBC's music archives, featuring a selection of tracks from some of the most important and innovative Welsh artists of the past few decades. The programme includes performances by Manic Street Preachers, Catatonia, Super Furry Animals, Marina and the Diamonds, Stereophonics, Feeder, Shakin' Stevens, Bonnie Tyler, Shirley Bassey and Tom Jones

programme.title: Manics Back to Blackwood
programme.desc: Manic Street Preachers return to perform in their home town of Blackwood for the first time in more than 25 years. The intimate gig at the Miners' Institute features versions of hits spanning three decades, behind-the-scenes footage and an interview with the band

programme.title: Wales: Music Nation with Huw Stephens
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which Huw delves deep into the surprising and varied story of music in Wales by putting together a unique Welsh mixtape. Jumping from choirs to pop groups, Tom Jones to the triple harp, haunting medieval music to urban rap, Huw explores what makes Welsh music unique, and the qualities it shares right across the centuries. Contributors include Tom Jones, Manic Street Preachers and Dafydd Iwan

programme.title: Wales: Music Nation with Huw Stephens
programme.desc: In the second of two programmes, Huw takes a trip to the south Wales valleys to meet the world-famous Treorchy male voice choir, and to dig into the story of how another choir helped Wales become known as the Land of Song. At the other end of the country, Huw meets singer-songwriter Dafydd Iwan, whose song Yma o Hyd has recently become a football anthem

programme.title: St David's Day at the BBC
programme.desc: A rummage through the BBC's music archives, featuring a selection of tracks from some of the most important and innovative Welsh artists of the past few decades. programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Noel Edmonds presents an edition from March 2, 1978, featuring performances by Darts, Kate Bush, Nick Lowe, Andy Williams, Samantha Sang, Rita Coolidge, the Tom Robinson Band and Abba

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The seasoned traveller explores the South American country, beginning in the north-east - where Europeans first landed and grew rich on the profits from sugar and tobacco plantations run with slave labour. In Sao Luis, Michael finds out about a ceremony based on a 200-year-old tale before heading to the coastal lagoons of the Lencois Maranhenses National Park. Journeying inland, he gets a glimpse of the fast-disappearing world of old-style cowboys known as vaqueiros, has his fortune read by a Candomble priest and learns to drum with the Olodum cultural collective

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The Monty Python star continues his first visit to Brazil by travelling by river from the northern border with Venezuela to the capital of Brasilia. Along the way he visits indigenous tribe the Yanomami, learning about the threat to their hunter-gatherer way of life, before watching a rehearsal by the Amazon Philharmonic Orchestra and searching for the remains of Henry Ford's unsuccessful attempt to build a vast rubber plantation in the middle of the rainforest. In Belem, music producer Priscilla explains why Amazonian women are such powerful forces, then he moves southwards, meeting rock star and political activist Dinho Ouro Preto, who believes that despite its social and environmental problems, the country is on the brink of becoming a superpower

programme.title: Paris Police 1905
programme.desc: The Paris vice squad begins to clean prostitutes off the city's streets, only to discover a man's body in the public park. Inspector Antoine Jouin heads up the investigation. In French

programme.title: Paris Police 1905
programme.desc: Lepine asks Jouin to remain discreet in his report of a death to avoid a scandal. Marguerite Steinheil prepares for the opening of a new collection of her husband's work, to which she has invited Lepine. In French

Today, its the third and last semi-final in which three of the artists who made it through have to create a piece for our celebrity commissioner, Dr Ronx. programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: Young Fortune and Juala Superboy are eight-year-old singer-rappers born and raised in Mathare, a vibrant place but one of Kenya's biggest slum areas. Determined to tell people everywhere about their home town, the boys have come together to write a new song all about the heroes in Mathare and the struggles they face every day. They travel around town to record their new song, attend a music workshop with their friends, perform their new song for the first time in front of a big audience, and even see amazing wildlife in Nairobi National Park. Their dream is to have the song heard by people outside of Nairobi - but will they manage to get it played on one of Africa's most famous radio stations?

programme.desc: Kika is a golden Labrador and a guide dog for her owner, Dr Amit, who is blind, which means he cannot see. She is trained to use her supersight to help Dr Amit do as many things as he can by himself. Together, they make the best team! Dr Amit has a very important letter to post. But first, he and Kika need to buy a stamp at the shop in time to catch the last post. Dr Amit checks his braille watch, which has little raised bumps to help him tell the time, while Kika dodges an enormous barrel outside the shop to help them find the door. Inside, Kika finds her way to the counter, only to be given an important lesson about queueing by a very helpful handbag. Kika helps Dr Amit buy his stamp and guides him to the postbox. But theyre too late! Theyve missed the post. Now they must race across town to find another postbox and track down Pete the postman. Will Dr Amit get his letter sent on time?

This market is also important for John, a third-generation Sussex fruit farmer. As well as picking his finest fresh fruit, he also makes apple juice so he can pocket as many sales as possible. programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Farming duo Ian and Luke are passionate about producing high quality meat, and a vital lifeline for selling it is Guildford Farmers' Market in Surrey. Ian's keen to use his hospitality background, attracting customers with cooking advice, and hopes that the warm weather will bring out the barbecuing buyers. This market is also important for John, a third-generation Sussex fruit farmer. As well as picking his finest fresh fruit, he also makes apple juice so he can pocket as many sales as possible. With over 1,000 potential customers expected, the farmers hope it will prove to be a lucrative day. Narrated by Denis Lawson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a young and expanding family to escape the city and find some space and tranquillity in the Hampshire countryside with their healthy 800,000 budget. Away from the house hunt, Ginny explores the county's rich maritime heritage on board the armoured battleship HMS Warrior, the pride of Queen Victoria's fleet

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Mark Hill go treasure hunting in The Fens. Mark falls head over heels for a very stylish, and shiny, mid-century kitchen appliance, while Irita uncovers something so gold, garish and gaudy it may not sell at auction. They also find a collectable with a very grisly and gruesome history

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Lucy, Fiona, Shannon and Janet compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lola and Jay return from their honeymoon and separately seek help for their money issues. Nish and Suki argue over Mitch ahead of their marriage blessing ceremony. Denise and Jack are horrified to learn that Amy has overheard Ravi's promiscuous behaviour whilst at Nugget's house

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Two brothers give investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett petrol head vibes as they ride into the Den with their motorcycle clothing brand. Also hoping to rev up the Dragons desire to invest is a matcha-based energy drink company and the entrepreneur behind an inclusive nail polish brand. However, there's competition for cash from a DIY tool that promises to provide measurements like no other and a multipurpose keyring. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates design a new men's skincare product, before pitching it to industry buyers. For one team, wrangling over a recipe leads to a disastrous skin-staining goo, while a lack of creativity on the other side results in an unoriginal concept. Unoriginal concoctions and disastrous recipes almost inevitably lead to a lack of sales. Later, in the boardroom, Lord Sugar is tempted to go beyond his usual single sacking

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce chairs the topical debate from Sunderland. programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Two hopeful goat farming couples, Sam and Jess from Sheffield and Mark and Graeme from Catterick, compete in an intense day of judging at the Royal Cheshire County Show

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah embarks on a hunt for a rural home in the Derbyshire Peak District with a couple of soon-to-be retirees who have a budget of 500,000, and for whom a pond is a high priority. Away from the house hunt, Sonali gets battle ready when she meets a master armourer and his apprentice who are upholding the tradition of this metalwork craft

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Mark Hill buys a 1970s motorbike, has high hopes for a biscuit tin and sets his sights on auction glory with a stereoscopic viewer. Away from her purchasing, Irita Marriott takes a trip to an historic farm to find out why music played a key role in spreading the Salvation Army's message over the years. programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Nish and Suki bless their marriage but she is distracted by paranoia about who heard her conversation with Eve. Much to Suki's horror, Eve attends the marriage blessing ceremony. Patrick and Vi are a success with the Walford Gazette but the reporter is so impressed that she insists on a follow up interview

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: Humphrey and Martha throw themselves into work in an attempt to distract themselves from recent events. For Humphrey, this means investigating one of the strangest cases he's ever encountered - an entire family has vanished, leaving their TV and lights on and dinner half-eaten. Martha prepares for the launch of her caf, but is thrown when a face from the past shows up. Death in Paradise spin-off, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton and featuring Ruth Madoc in one of her final TV roles

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Famous thriller author Frank O'Toole is found stabbed through the heart after taking an early morning swim in the ocean. Suspicion soon falls on the victim's wife Valerie, but with eyewitnesses confirming he was swimming alone, how could anyone have got from the house to the sea without being detected? Away from the investigation, Dwayne concentrates on finding a date for a voodoo love festival. Whodunit, guest starring Simon Callow, Imogen Stubbs, and Sian Gibson of Car Share fame

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The first of two compilations of highlights from the recent series. Among the guests featured are Taylor Swift, Daniel Craig, Eddie Redmayne, Lashana Lynch, Bono, Kate Hudson, Ian McKellen, Paul Mescal, Geena Davis, Stormzy, Lesley Manville, Colin Farrell and Bruce Springsteen

programme.title: A View from the Terrace
programme.desc: Craig G Telfer, Craig Fowler, Shaughan McGuigan, Robert Borthwick and Joel Sked present a sideways look at Scottish football, dissecting of ins and outs of the week's action, with a variety of features covering the full spectrum from the giants to the minnows

programme.desc: Boston Celtics v Brooklyn Nets (Tip-off 12.30am). All the action from the Eastern Conference encounter at TD Garden

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Poppy O'Toole and Bryn Williams, plus special guest Alesha Dixon. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain provides the inspiration to bring the joy of baking into everyday lives, and celebrates bakers across Britain, shining a light on their favourite bakes. She begins with treats for an easy Afternoon Tea, from striped meringue lollipops to coffee cake with dalgona coffee cream and dreamy butterscotch cheesecake bars, and meets Mina Said-Allsopp, who shares her secrets to a gluten-free chocolate sourdough

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Liverpool v Manchester United. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Manchester City and Newcastle United

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Catherine Southon help two teams scour Exeter's Westpoint Arena for items, while host Natasha Raskin Sharp finds out about the ancient skill of enamelling

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a couple from London with a 550,000 budget to make a rural move to Wiltshire, and joins a group of bicycling enthusiasts on a ride through Longleat Estate

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the second session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The women's pole vault final gets under way and the men's heptathlon continues with the high jump. The women's 800m semi-finals also take place, with Great Britain's Keely Hodgkinson the reigning champion. With analysis by Jessica Ennis-Hill and Denise Lewis, and commentary from Steve Cram and Andrew Cotter

programme.title: Sportscene Results
programme.desc: David Currie presents a round-up of the afternoon's main football news and results. Plus, a look back at the week's talking points

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the celebrity version of the classic quiz. Yvette Fielding, Helen McGinn, Matt Richardson and Sarah Keith-Lucas are in the famous black chair, answering questions on Morecambe & Wise, The Hollywood novels of Jackie Collins, Concorde, and the film Labyrinth

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, which sees former England rugby star Ugo Monye, tennis player Judy Murray, goalkeeper David James and Scottish footballer Pat Nevin taking it in turns to cross the floor by only stepping on the correct answers - and doing their best to avoid the wrong ones. For the final crossing, those who have been successful join forces for a chance to take home the money for their chosen charities

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian returns with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Motsi Mabuse, Jon Richardson, Tom Skinner, Carol Vorderman, Joe Marler, Rav Wilding and Joanne McNally

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman host a news-themed episode of the celebrity quiz. Cathy Newman, Keme Nzerem, Lucrezia Millarini, Nina Nannar, Mike Bushell, Kasia Madera, Jennie Bond, Nicholas Owen pair up to come up with the answers that no one else could think of

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jacob struggles to gain the respect he needs from his department, and feels that Robyn is not putting in the effort she needs to. Stevie is haunted by Marcus' abuse, but Faith helps her to both move forward and see that he suffers some consequences for his crimes. Rash is left struggling with his Dad's welfare after his carer is attacked

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Newcastle United at Etihad Stadium and Arsenal v Bournemouth at Emirates Stadium. The Citizens and Newcastle shared the spoils in a thrilling 3-3 draw at St James' Park in August, but the champions will have hoped to make home advantage count this time around. Arsenal are battling City for the title, and will have expected a second win of the season against the Cherries. Plus, Aston Villa v Crystal Palace, Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United, Chelsea v Leeds United, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Tottenham Hotspur and Southampton v Leicester City

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Steven Thompson presents action from the latest fixtures, including Rangers v Kilmarnock, Hearts v St Johnstone and Livingston v Hibernian. With analysis from Neil McCann and James McFadden

programme.title: Going in Style (2017)
programme.desc: Joe Harding, Willie Davis and Albert Garner are lifelong friends who have been swindled out of their pension money by a Brooklyn bank. So the seasoned pals decide to steal their cash back in a daring robbery. Director Zach Braff's remake of George Burns's 1979 heist caper, starring Morgan Freeman, Michael Caine and Alan Arkin

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Actor Adam Woodyatt swaps the Walford skyline for Northern Ireland's spectacular causeway coast, as he checks into the B&B. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Motsi Mabuse, Jon Richardson, Tom Skinner, Carol Vorderman, Joe Marler, Rav Wilding and Joanne McNally

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman host a news-themed episode of the celebrity quiz. Cathy Newman, Keme Nzerem, Lucrezia Millarini, Nina Nannar, Mike Bushell, Kasia Madera, Jennie Bond, Nicholas Owen pair up to come up with the answers that no one else could think of

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jacob struggles to gain the respect he needs from his department, and feels that Robyn is not putting in the effort she needs to. Stevie is haunted by Marcus' abuse, but Faith helps her to both move forward and see that he suffers some consequences for his crimes. Rash is left struggling with his Dad's welfare after his carer is attacked

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Newcastle United at Etihad Stadium and Arsenal v Bournemouth at Emirates Stadium. The Citizens and Newcastle shared the spoils in a thrilling 3-3 draw at St James' Park in August, but the champions will have hoped to make home advantage count this time around. Arsenal are battling City for the title, and will have expected a second win of the season against the Cherries. Plus, Aston Villa v Crystal Palace, Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United, Chelsea v Leeds United, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Tottenham Hotspur and Southampton v Leicester City

programme.title: Going in Style (2017)
programme.desc: Joe Harding, Willie Davis and Albert Garner are lifelong friends who have been swindled out of their pension money by a Brooklyn bank. So the seasoned pals decide to steal their cash back in a daring robbery. Director Zach Braff's remake of George Burns's 1979 heist caper, starring Morgan Freeman, Michael Caine and Alan Arkin

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: The war in Ukraine is the biggest in Europe since World War II. Millions of children have been forced to leave their homes to escape the fighting, but many either others couldnt or didnt. Hearing from just some of those who are living through war, this film lets the children caught in the conflict tell their stories in their own words. Covering fear, loss, strength and hope, they detail the life-changing events of the war and the impact it is having on their day-to-day life. They share their experiences of surviving attacks from the air, being forced to live for weeks at a time in bomb shelters, and their towns and villages becoming occupied by Russian soldiers. Ricky Boleto finds out how the children are coping with living in a country at war.

programme.title: The Rock (1996)
programme.desc: A renegade general and his crack team of mercenaries take over the abandoned fortress prison of Alcatraz and threaten San Francisco with toxic nerve-gas rockets to extort a massive ransom. Action thriller, with Sean Connery, Nicolas Cage and Ed Harris

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny faces three target challenges, but will he succeed and avoid a gunge-filled forfeit?

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Cornea invites Lloyd and his family to dinner, but they can't stomach Cornea's unique cooking and adopt a series of bizarre ways to try and avoid eating the food without offending their host.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to compete with Berry and prove that he's 'more caring' by rescuing flies whether they want or need rescuing or not - however, his zealousness backfires when he attempts a daring rescue 'outside'!

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: An accident at an asteroid-based mining facility sends the rock hurtling toward the Sun, with crewman Ned Tedford still on-site. Alan and Kayo deploy Thunderbird Three for the rescue mission, but when a rogue solar flare knocks out their sensors, they are forced to find a way to alter the asteroid's trajectory so that it loops around the sun instead of plummeting to its ultra-hot surface. Animated adventure, with the voices of Rasmus Hardiker and Angel Coulby

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Pigsy challenges MK to deliver an order in an allotted time to the Monkey King, so MK goes through obstacles that challenge his focus in order to accomplish his goal.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. The Demon Bull King's family has found a mysterious power source that will allow them to reclaim their former glory, but it's locked behind an ancient gate. The key to it, which can open any door, was given to MK as thanks for saving the city over and over - after messing around with the key, Red Son finds them. A game of cat and mouse ensues as DBK's family tries to get the key and MK and Mei attempt to keep it away.

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: Bumbling detective Inspector Gadget battles the forces of M.A.D. with the aid of his gadgets and gizmos, his niece Penny and her intrepid dog, Brain

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: Bumbling detective Inspector Gadget battles the forces of M.A.D. with the aid of his gadgets and gizmos, his niece Penny and her intrepid dog, Brain

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo is fed up with being chosen all the time - every time a student is summoned to the blackboard or asked to perform a chore, he's the one picked out! When Mr Brick plans to choose someone to be John-Cedrick's partner for the I Love My School civic project, Mo decides to use the Spectral Spectre to avoid that fate. He wants to become invisible, but when his best friend Lenny gets chosen instead, Mo will have to get his friend out of this terrible situation.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Ever since they found out that Hollywood film star Timothy Bloom is JC's cousin, JC's 'courtiers' follow him around the school. Sam and Stella are shocked at his abuse of power, but Mo doesn't really care... that is, until he is forbidden from entering the school bathroom as it is now exclusively used as JC's headquarters. This is the last straw - determined to eliminate JC's 'royal court', Mo asks the Sceptre for the power to turn whoever he wants into his own courtier.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at the house by Homes Under the Hammer presenter Martin Roberts and former Welsh rugby union star Scott Quinnell, with recipes for tagine, jalfrezi chicken and steak. Plus, chefs Sabrina Gidda and Daniel Galmiche serve up some mouth-watering dishes of their own

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott demonstrates recipes featuring herbs, cooking a breakfast dish of huevos rancheros with pico de gallo, and a fish sandwich with a tamarind mayo. Thuy Pham marries herbs with Vietnamese speciality banh xeo pancakes, while actress and keen cook Lisa Snowdon makes pan-fried mackerel with warm herb and rice salad

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 1.50 Morebattle Hurdle from Kelso, supported by races at 1.15, 2.25, 3.00 and 3.35. Plus, races at 1.30 and 3.15 from Doncaster, and 2.10 and 2.45 from Newbury. With analysis from Luke Harvey and Andrew Thornton, reports by Oli Bell and Natalie Green, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: A look back at some of the most nail-biting end games from the Tipping Point archives

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special

programme.title: Starstruck

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to compete with Berry and prove that he's 'more caring' by rescuing flies whether they want or need rescuing or not - however, his zealousness backfires when he attempts a daring rescue 'outside'!

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: An accident at an asteroid-based mining facility sends the rock hurtling toward the Sun, with crewman Ned Tedford still on-site. Alan and Kayo deploy Thunderbird Three for the rescue mission, but when a rogue solar flare knocks out their sensors, they are forced to find a way to alter the asteroid's trajectory so that it loops around the sun instead of plummeting to its ultra-hot surface. Animated adventure, with the voices of Rasmus Hardiker and Angel Coulby

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. The Demon Bull King's family has found a mysterious power source that will allow them to reclaim their former glory, but it's locked behind an ancient gate. The key to it, which can open any door, was given to MK as thanks for saving the city over and over - after messing around with the key, Red Son finds them. A game of cat and mouse ensues as DBK's family tries to get the key and MK and Mei attempt to keep it away.

He wants to become invisible, but when his best friend Lenny gets chosen instead, Mo will have to get his friend out of this terrible situation.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The fair arrives in the village and Mrs Hughes finds herself the centre of speculation when she meets a former suitor who makes her question her position at Downton. Meanwhile, Violet and Isobel lock horns over a medical ailment affecting Molesley, and Carson fears there is a thief at work in the grounds. Costume drama, starring Maggie Smith, Hugh Bonneville, Phyllis Logan, Penelope Wilton, Jim Carter and Kevin Doyle

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick and Jo buy an engagement ring, but receive a hostile response to their news from her mother. Greengrass angers Blaketon by standing bail for a burglar. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry, Juliette Gruber and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the discovery of an unidentified teenage boy's body in a coastal town's shipyard, who is revealed to be listed as a missing person, having absconded from the care of his support worker. Vera discovers that the quiet community where he was found is plagued by a serious drugs problem - despite the fact that the only known dealer in the area has turned his back on crime. The victim could be the answer to the mystery, but a wall of silence surrounds his death. Mark Addy guest stars

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a young man is found dead and stark naked out on the Fens, Will and Geordie discover ties to a Cambridge research project experimenting with mind-altering drugs. Its arrogant professor is a proponent of the drug LSD in his psychotherapy sessions, but Will and Geordie start wondering whether there is more going on. As the case proceeds, Will's feelings of guilt about his father's death and his conflicted feelings about Ellie start to take their toll. Elsewhere, the Keatings suffer an awkward dinner party and the Chapman feud shows no sign of relenting. Robson Green and Tom Brittney star

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: It's the day of Saif's funeral, and as Jenn watches closely for any suspicious behaviour, divisions within the Rahman household widen. Adnan is anxious about the repercussions of last night's incident, but Jenn's attempts to help are overshadowed by Mariam's reaction to events at the funeral. Back at the station, Clarkie's investigation leads to a significant breakthrough about a possible motive for Saif's murder, which suggests the killer might be connected to the Rahmans. But before Jenn can investigate further, some shocking personal news throws her off course. Crime drama, starring Marsha Thomason

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David plans a surprise party for Karen's 40th birthday, even though she'd rather not bother, and Anna rekindles her romance with Simon now he's returned from Australia a single man once more. Jess is devastated to receive disappointing A level results, meaning she can't get away from home, and newcomers the Morecroft family arrive in Skelthwaite, hoping to shake off their tragic past

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Stephen is faced with a dilemma when he meets an old flame. Karen and David begin to worry about the whereabouts of Jess, and an elderly patient is distraught when his partner is put into care. Drama following community nurses living and working in a small Yorkshire town, starring Leslie Ash, Phil Middlemiss and Thomas Craig

programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran

Potions, witchcraft, marital infidelity and a ruthless campaign to save the area form the heady brew that convinces the detective he is dealing with a case of murder. Wendy Craig guest stars, with John Nettles and Daniel Casey

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: As the village prepares for the annual flower show, Isobel finds herself in conflict with Violet, and Mary is introduced to a potential suitor, but it would seem she only has eyes for Matthew. Anna realises who is to blame when a valuable snuff box goes missing, and Mrs Patmore tearfully reveals her fears to Carson that her career may be coming to an end. Meanwhile, O'Brien engineers a way for Edith to take revenge on Mary. Drama, starring Maggie Smith and Robert Bathurst

programme.desc: A special constable mysteriously disappears after a row with pig farmer Betty Sutch. Nick Berry and Bill Maynard star

programme.desc: Pauline grows increasingly frustrated with her role at the surgery and starts to interfere with Martin's work, much to the GP's annoyance. The former surgeon talks to Bert, who is feeling down after his son Al's decision to go travelling, before coming face to face with the village's new police officer. Comedy drama series, starring Martin Clunes

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Bert comes to the conclusion that a new challenge will help him move on from Al's departure and decides to open a restaurant, but a spate of food-poisoning cases coincides with his first day of business. Martin meets Poppy, the surgery's new receptionist, and Pauline returns from her course. Comedy drama, starring Ian McNeice and Martin Clunes

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Keen to unwind, Geordie and Will head to a charity boxing match at Vic's gym. However, as Matthew and Luke face off in the ring the bout takes an unexpected twist. Will wonders if he's misjudged Matthew all along and when two boys are later found near death, Will must face up to his own part in the tragedy to help uncover the truth. Meanwhile, Leonard tries to reunite the warring Chapmans, who seem determined never to see eye-to-eye again. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: Shazia's explosive revelation threatens to destroy the Rahman family, but Mariam sees an opportunity to try and turn her life around. programme.title: The Bay

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo help reorganise the seed museum owned by the descendants of famous botanist Edwin Pargeter - but it is not long before a man is found dead in the family's garden. In an effort to trace his killer, Rosemary involves colleagues from the Royal Horticultural Society at Kew Gardens, and soon the race is on to identify a batch of mysterious seeds before it falls into the wrong hands. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star

programme.desc: A petty thief is impaled with a pitchfork in sleepy Midsomer Mallow, jeopardising the residents' chances of winning a 'perfect village' competition. programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A commercial decision to turn Midsomer Deverell's memorial garden into a tea shop proves fatal for members of the Inkpen family. DCI Barnaby's investigation unearths more than mere local hostility as he lifts the lid on long-buried secrets. Anna Calder-Marshall and Margaret Tyzack guest star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A horse whisperer disappears in Newton Magna, bringing Barnaby face to face with long-standing adversary Melvyn Stockard. Murder mystery, guest starring Larry Lamb (EastEnders, Gavin & Stacey), with John Nettles and Daniel Casey

MK is trapped in the nefarious Calabash, an ancient magical device wielded by Jin and Yin, the Gold and Silver Demons... can he break out of it?

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Everyone in the city is abuzz with talk of an upcoming street race that will grant the winner immortality - Mei and MK decide to enter the race, but a disagreement causes them to compete against each other. Their frustration boils over, causing them both to crash and the Demon Bull family to take the lead - when this happens, Mei and MK work together in order to create a new race car and win the race.

programme.title: LEGO Marvel Avengers: Climate Conundrum
programme.desc: Animated series based on the Marvel superheroes team. With the world's weather out of control, the Avengers must break into teams and trek across the globe to shut down the network of Weather Towers that are now under the control of Red Skull. It's a high-stakes adventure with Captain America and War Machine in the desert - with the help of Black Panther and Thor - Iron Man and Justin Hammer in the jungle, and Black Widow, Hulk and Hawkeye in America's farmland.

programme.title: Drop Dead Weird

Bec wants to help Makeaway Takeaway go viral on the Internet, but can she come up with something unique to spread the word? She has an idea for a technique that's 'un-fork-getable' and helps a customer make a 'Sloth Bag' for her up and coming sleepover - Bec also delivers an awesome 'Sweet Dispenser' with just three ingredients and some crafty recycling, and a circus instructor gets a surprise from Bec too!

programme.title: Ted's Top Ten
programme.desc: Comedy series following the misadventures of Ted and his school friends and family. Ted has been putting off completing his science project - a mock-up of a volcano - while Jai is ready to erupt himself at having to ride a kids' Spiderman bike and desperate to upgrade. Ted feigns illness to fool Lani and buy himself more time to complete the project, while Stu is genuinely sick and not helped by the fact that Bodhi secretly brings a dog home who proceeds to torment him in his fevered state.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.desc: Animated comedy featuring two trouble-making young friends who re-imagine their grumpy headmaster as a superhero looking to fight crime and save their city. The boys want to go on a fun scavenger hunt, so Krupp sends them on a wild goose chase to find the egg of a Barfilisk - a creature that causes kids to barf rainbows - which George and Harold made up! programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo fears being forced to take singing lessons with Amber if he fails Mr Brick's mystery test, and with the grades that he usually gets, he definitely won't be able to avoid it! He asks the Sceptre for the power to see into the future so he can find out what the subject of the test will be ahead of time, but when Sam discovers that Mo has essentially asked for the power to cheat, she vows to stop him from carrying out his plan but then has a strange vision...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Wanda entrusts Mo and Sam with a strange crystal - she's not exactly sure what it does, but it seems to be related to the Spectral Sceptre. Sam keeps the crystal in her school locker because she doesn't trust her clumsy half-brother Mo with it, but when Sam loses the crystal after a mishap and it gets stuck inside John-Cedrick's locker, Sam is forced to ask for the power to go through walls so that she can recover the crystal undetected and avoid embarrassment.

programme.title: Stephen Fry: Willem & Frieda - Defying the Nazis
programme.desc: The actor and writer visits Amsterdam to learn how, during the occupation of the Netherlands in the Second World War, painter Willem Arondeus and cellist Frieda Belinfante, used their artistic skills to forge identity cards that saved thousands of Jews from the death camps. The Nazis exploited the fact that Holland had the most sophisticated identity card system in the world. Each card they issued had a duplicate stored in the Amsterdam Central Records Office to prevent forgery. Willem led a daring raid to destroy the duplicate cards. Fry also discovers why this story has remained largely hidden to this day

Not only that, but half of the plot can't even be built on due an underground mains sewer. All they're left with is a very small triangle on which to build their future life together. programme.desc: Lisa begins to feel increasingly neglected by Homer and tries to worm her way into his affections by feigning an interest in American football. programme.desc: Homer uncovers a plan to move his beloved Springfield Isotopes baseball team to New Mexico, so he takes desperate measures to keep them in town and goes on hunger strike in protest. With the guest voice of Stacy Keach

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Crossroads House owned by Julie and Alistair Musgrave, who pride themselves on their full English fry-up and Cumberland banger. Jamie and Leila are surprised by the B&B's roadside location but impressed by their newly spick-and-span room, while Jill and Inez dig into the mismatched decor in theirs. At drinks, Julie and Alistair reveal their entrepreneurial ambitions and are confident their breakfast offering will bring home the win. In the morning, Jamie and Leila are feeling rough after a restless night whilst in the kitchen Julie is experiencing a last-minute crisis of confidence

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to trade feedback, starting with The Old Rose & Crown, where Jamie and Leila lay into the linen. The B&Bers discuss lukewarm reactions to the facilities, problems with paying for breakfast and picky comments about the paintwork. Things take an emotional turn when Julie and Alistair chew over their bad breakfast score. There are harsh truths, heated debates and disagreements as the payments are revealed before the winner is finally announced

programme.title: The Karate Kid (1984)

At Patara, she finds a building with connections to the American constitution and finds the city to be the hometown of St Nicholas, also known as Father Christmas. She also investigates exciting new developments at the world-famous site of Troy where she reveals the truth behind the tales of the Trojan War

programme.title: Elizabeth & Margaret: Service and Sacrifice
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the relationship between Queen Elizabeth II and her younger sister, revealing how Princess Margaret sacrificed her own happiness for her sibling and the monarchy. The programme explores how Margaret shaped the Queen in unexpected ways, from the early years when they were the perfect royal pair, to the 1960s when it was Margaret who stole the show, through the scandals and backlash of the 1970s

programme.desc: At the age of 80, Jimmy Tarbuck tells the story of his extraordinary career. Over three months he has recorded all the anecdotes from a lifetime in the limelight. programme.desc: An affectionate look back at the comedian's life and career in a documentary charting his early struggles to launch his showbusiness career through to hosting the Royal Variety Performance and his arena-filling tours. programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: In June 1985, TWA flight 847 made a routine stop-off in Athens, Greece. Its destination was Rome, but that changed after armed Lebanese militia boarded the plane. Against the backdrop of the Middle East conflict, the terrorists had one objective in mind - the release of hundreds of Islamic prisoners detained in Israel. Seizing the US airliner shortly after take-off, the passengers and crew - including singer Demis Roussos - endured a three-day ordeal involving a stream of landings across various airports. This documentary recalls their experiences

programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: The story of the simultaneous hijacking of five passenger jets by a Palestinian militant group in 1970. When an attempt to take over a plane that had just left Amsterdam was foiled, the group responded by seizing control of three more aircraft and diverting them to the Jordanian desert, while a fourth was blown up on the runway at Cairo. Featuring contributions from pilots and cabin crew

programme.title: Carol Klein's Great British Gardens
programme.desc: Carol visits spectacular gardens across the UK and meets the people who look after them, beginning with Great Dixter in Northiam Village in the Sussex High Weald. Head gardener Fergus Garrett talks about how he endeavours to use the grounds as a living laboratory of horticultural experimentation, and encourage biodiversity of plant and animal species

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George plays hide-and-seek with Peppa, but is not very good at it

programme.title: Fireman Sam
