programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Uncle Otis is hurtling down Jake's Mountain in a runaway mine car, so Ryder and the Pups need to rescue him before it crashes

programme.title: Yangtse Incident (1957)
programme.desc: A British frigate is heavily shelled and captured by Chinese communists on the Yangtse River in 1949. After a failed rescue mission by a sister ship, the remaining crew members put into action a daring escape plan that involves disguising the vessel and slipping her moorings under the cover of darkness. Fact-based action adventure, starring Richard Todd, William Hartnell and Akim Tamiroff

programme.title: A Town Like Alice (1956)
programme.desc: Second World War PoW Jean Paget is sent on a gruelling forced march between Japanese labour camps, but finds comfort in her friendship with Australian captive Joe Harman. During the journey Joe is caught stealing, tied to a cross and left to die. After the conflict is over, Jean is startled to receive a letter postmarked in Joe's home town of Alice Springs. Jack Lee's drama, based on the novel by Nevil Shute, starring Virginia McKenna, Peter Finch, Takagi and Jean Anderson

programme.title: Howards End (1992)
programme.desc: A chance encounter during a cruise throws the romantic Schlegel sisters into the paths of the Wilcoxes, an industrious family headed by the well-meaning but strait-laced Henry. When aristocratic matriarch Ruth Wilcox bequeaths her family home to Margaret Schlegel, her children are outraged and dispose of the will, setting the stage for a conflict with tragic consequences. Merchant Ivory period drama, based on EM Forster's novel, starring Emma Thompson, Anthony Hopkins and Helena Bonham Carter

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee II (1988)
programme.desc: The rugged Australian adventurer sets out to save his reporter girlfriend from New York drug dealers. Having rescued her from their clutches, he realises they will soon be coming after him - so he decides to even the odds by luring them to the Outback for a final showdown. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Charles S Dutton

programme.title: The Godfather Part II (1974)
programme.desc: Mafia don Michael Corleone sets out to clinch a make-or-break deal with an ageing gangster - but his plans are blown apart by a traitor within the family. Michael's story is intercut with flashback sequences chronicling the early life of his father Vito, as he makes the shift from immigrant grocery-store clerk to Mob kingpin. Francis Ford Coppola's Oscar-winning crime drama sequel, with Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, John Cazale, Michael V Gazzo and Lee Strasberg

programme.title: Her Smell (2018)
programme.desc: A self-destructive punk rocker struggles with sobriety while trying to recapture the creative inspiration that led her band to success. Writer/director Alex Ross Perry's drama, starring Elisabeth Moss, Cara Delevingne and Dan Stevens

programme.title: Shenandoah (1965)
programme.desc: A Virginian farmer is left to raise seven children after his wife dies. He tries to keep his family out of the American Civil War, but when Union troops abduct his son, and his son-in-law enlists with the Confederates, he is unable to maintain his neutral stance and is dragged into the conflict. Western, starring James Stewart, Doug McClure, Rosemary Forsyth, Katharine Ross and Patrick Wayne

programme.title: The File on Thelma Jordon (1950)
programme.desc: An assistant district attorney falls for a woman suspected of murdering her aunt, so he covers up evidence that may incriminate her as he attempts to get her acquitted. Film noir, starring Barbara Stanwyck and Wendell Corey

programme.title: Thunder Bay (1953)
programme.desc: A former Navy engineer comes up with a plan to establish an offshore oil drilling site on the Louisiana coast. However, his scheme is threatened by dangerous weather conditions, his own treacherous financial backers, and irate locals who fear for their fishing business. Action adventure, with James Stewart and Joanne Dru

programme.title: 7th Cavalry (1956)
programme.desc: An army officer is branded a coward for failing to fight in the Battle of the Little Bighorn, and is unable to convince anyone that official business had detained him. In a bid to repair his damaged reputation, he leads a cavalry detail to retrieve the dead from the battlefield. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Jay C Flippen and Jeanette Nolan

programme.title: Rat Race (2001)
programme.desc: A casino magnate approaches a group of no-hopers with the offer of $2million to whoever retrieves the sum from a locker in a train station in New Mexico, prompting a madcap cross-continent dash. Meanwhile, the casino owner's high-rolling gambler friends place bets on which of the bumbling contestants will win. Comedy, with Rowan Atkinson, John Cleese, Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Bates, Seth Green and Cuba Gooding Jr

programme.title: The Godfather Coda: The Death of Michael Corleone (2020)
programme.desc: Twenty years after ordering the murder of his brother, ageing don Michael Corleone is close to fulfilling his dream of severing his family's Mafia ties and gaining legitimacy, but vengeful enemies and the actions of his hot-headed nephew soon draw him back into a life of crime. Francis Ford Coppola's 2020 director's cut of The Godfather: Part III, starring Al Pacino, Andy Garcia, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, Eli Wallach and Bridget Fonda

programme.title: The Furies (2019)
programme.desc: A kidnapped woman finds herself an unwilling participant in a lethal game where women are hunted by masked men. Thriller, starring Airlie Dodds and Linda Ngo

programme.title: 127 Hours (2010)
programme.desc: A mountain climber gets stuck in an isolated canyon when a boulder crushes his arm. Remaining trapped for five days, he comes to realise no one is going to save him, and that survival will depend on a particularly drastic course of action. Danny Boyle's fact-based drama, with James Franco and Kate Mara

programme.title: Annie (1982)
programme.desc: An orphan wins the fatherly affections of a tough-talking billionaire - but the no-good owner of the orphanage and her brother are out to ruin the girl's chances of happiness and make a quick profit in the process. Musical, directed by John Huston, based on the stage play. Starring Aileen Quinn, Albert Finney, Carol Burnett and Tim Curry

programme.title: Turner & Hooch (1989)
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detective's well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson

programme.title: Cutthroat Island (1995)
programme.desc: A tough female pirate enlists the help of an educated slave in finding the three parts of a map leading to buried treasure. However, one of the pieces is in the hands of her cruel uncle, and she also has to find the loot before her crew mutinies or the British Navy catches up with her. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella and Maury Chaykin

programme.title: The Martian (2015)
programme.desc: A manned mission to Mars is abruptly abandoned, with one crew member left for dead. However, the astronaut has survived and faces a series of challenges - to contact Earth and arrange his rescue and to survive for the years it will take for a spacecraft to reach him on resources intended to last the crew a month. Ridley Scott's sci-fi drama based on the novel by Andy Weir, starring Matt Damon, Jessica Chastain, Kristen Wiig and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July (1989)
programme.desc: Oliver Stone's fact-based drama chronicles the life of Ron Kovic, an eager-to-impress, patriotic Marine Corps recruit, who endures terrifying experiences during the Vietnam conflict that leave him paralysed from the chest down. On his return home, he undergoes a harrowing journey of physical and mental recovery that leads him to question the whole purpose of the war. Starring Tom Cruise, Willem Dafoe, Kyra Sedgwick and Josh Evans

programme.title: The Shallows (2016)

With the deadly aquatic predator between her and the beach and her safe haven slowly disappearing as the tide comes in, she faces a life or death struggle to get safely back to dry land. Thriller, starring Blake Lively and Oscar Jaenada

Writer/director Harmony Korine's comedy, starring Matthew McConaughey, Isla Fisher, Snoop Dogg, Zac Efron and Jonah Hill

With tensions rising, the food not up to scratch and everyone playing the blame game, the chef is faced with one of the trickiest situations he's ever encountered

Twenty-nine-year-old Lewis - whose narcolepsy caused him to fall asleep on a previous date - is paired with DJ Thom, while lager and football-lover Jessica is introduced to fellow northerner and pub-lover Ryan

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. The Bae Abermaw Hotel is first and hosts Rosie and Dexter want to get to the bottom of Tracy's broken bath issue

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Catching up with two sets of house-hunters at different stages of life. In 2019, Alistair and Candice were searching in Swindon's pricey old town. Kirstie Allsopp realised that their budget and expectations didn't quite match, so it was going to be a tough search with some hard-hitting compromises. A year earlier, Thomas and Angelina had sold their family home of 32 years and were downsizing in Bolton, to be closer to their family. Phil Spencer returns to find out how both couples have got on since cameras stopped rolling

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It

With four cats, two dogs and a yard full of hens, the house was at bursting point. Kirstie heads to the pair's new home in Llangammarch Wells, Powys, where huge changes have occurred, including the addition of a peacock to the household menagerie. Do Lucia and Matt feel they got the life they really wanted after all?

programme.desc: Dick and Angel throw a garden party for Arthur and Dorothy's friends, with traditional games including handmade giant dominoes and a treasure hunt around the Chateau grounds. Angel makes a layered jelly with ice cream and another of her specialities - rose petal and honey sandwiches. Meanwhile, the scaffolding arrives and work can start on re-slating the Chateau roof for the first time in 150 years

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows Matt and Sophie White from Sussex as they build a giant family house of fun for themselves and their children. Going against the norm of designing a serious and practical home, the couple's property features a revolving bookcase door, secret dens, hiding places and a fireman's pole. Matt uses a steel frame system to allow them to change the layout of the property, and other changes include amending the window shapes and sizes, and adding a half floor to create a James Bond room

Having been knocked unconscious for 10 minutes, the medical team must urgently assess him for internal injuries. Anne, 74, arrives with a sharp pain in her chest, 51-year-old taxi driver Mark receives treatment for a cut on his finger caused by broken glass, and 92-year-old Betty is brought in by ambulance after her carers found her with slurred speech and a shaking hand

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

With debris in his wound, doctors are concerned he could develop a life-threatening infection. programme.desc: The search for a Kent woman's relatives runs into difficulties on her father's side of the family. The team uncovers the story of a naval hero during a case in Wales

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: General manager Garry Healey and housekeeper Zara Doherty welcome their rivals to the Cliffemount Hotel in Runswick Bay in North Yorkshire. Guests Lana and Alistair are wowed by the views, but Belgian sisters Daniele and Chantal don't think the dcor reflects their surroundings. After an afternoon fossil hunting on the beach, Garry entertains his guests at dinner with a taste of his past, and gives them a sight to remember. In the morning, Claire and Adam think their breakfast lacks flavour, and the feedback leaves Garry and Zara wanting answers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Hospitality newcomers Alistair Arundel and Lana Keptanare welcome their rivals to the Quayside Hotel in Boston in Lincolnshire. Most of the guests are bowled over by the bling, but Claire feels like she's stuck in a neon nightmare. Feathers are ruffled during an afternoon of parrot-handling, with Garry and Zara feeling that Claire and Adam have shown their true colours. At dinner, the guests are impressed by Alistair and Lana's renovation story, but Alistair takes a dim view of Claire's LED criticism

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Claire Lennon and Adam De Marco welcome their rivals to Hollington Park Glamping near Newbury, Berkshire. Sisters Daniele and Chantal are happy glampers but the other guests are shocked by the communal composting toilet. After an arty afternoon, Garry and Zara put aside their differences with their hosts. At dinner, Lana and Alistair don't hold back their feelings about camping, and at breakfast they reveal the full horror of their night under the stars. The feedback reveals that sharing isn't caring when it comes to the communal composting loo, and Claire and Adam have to face the fact that glamping isn't to everyone's taste

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sisters Daniele Spiers and Chantal Wirth welcome their rivals to Swan House in Kelvedon in Essex. The traditional decor impresses the guests, but there's cleanliness criticism all round, and Lana has wardrobe woes. During an afternoon of wine tasting, Claire and Adam reveal that their feedback hasn't left a bad taste in the mouth, and over dinner the group finds out more about Daniele's romantic past. In the morning, Garry and Zara wake up on the wrong side of bed after a disturbed night's sleep

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. The Cliffemount Hotel is first to host and Garry and Zara want to get to grips with Claire and Adam's breakfast grumbles

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Catching up with two house-hunters with different needs - Indu and Jason, who in 2018 wanted to find a family home with potential in Guildford, and fashion designer Shane, who was keen to leave the bustle of the city and make a new life on the north Kent coast way back in 2003. Now Phil Spencer returns to find out if the homes that he and Kirstie Allsopp found have reaped rewards

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer return to find out how some of the families they have helped are getting on since they decided whether to redesign their problematic homes or sell up and move on. They begin with Paul and Dawn from the first edition back in April 2015, who were at loggerheads over what to do with their detached country home. Its isolated location on the outskirts of Huddersfield made it perfect for astronomy fanatic Paul, but Dawn was desperate to move, hating its dysfunctional layout

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: House-hunters Taz and Tracy from London are looking for a property in Cyprus. Taz's family are originally from the island, and he and Tracy have been enjoying holidays there for nearly 15 years. Now they're in a position to buy their own holiday home and have chosen the area around Protaras in south east Cyprus. With a maximum budget of 70,000, they're hoping property expert Scarlette Douglas can find them the perfect place

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: It's the quarter-final, and the remaining five potters face an altered reality as they throw and radically alter an abstract coffee set. The bucket of doom returns as judges Keith and Rich set a second challenge to throw multiple high-footed rice bowls under pressure, but who will secure an all-important place in the semi-final?

programme.title: The Wall: Cover Your Tracks
programme.desc: Celine begins to understand the modus operandi of the killer - the targets are already victims in some way. Meanwhile, two locals are on the run. Mystery drama, starring Isabel Richer. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 68-year-old professional actor visits St George's Hospital after injuring his shoulder while rushing to catch a train, and a check-up indicates he may need corrective surgery to set things right, but further assessment suggests he might be living with a much more serious condition. An octogenarian couple are rushed in to A&E after being knocked over by a motorcyclist while crossing the road, and the police maintain an active presence as paramedics bring in a man who has collapsed after a suspected drug overdose. Plus, an 88-year-old woman with a swollen leg discusses her ill-fated marriage to a much younger man nearly four decades ago

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Pub landlord Tony is brought in with burnt legs as a result of his barbecue gas cylinder exploding - made slightly worse by the fact he was only wearing boxer shorts at the time. Henry, a 93-year-old war veteran, is rushed in with severe breathing difficulties, and builder Bill was knocked unconscious after falling off his shed. His CT scan reveals he has broken his neck in three places, and he may need surgery to avoid damage to his spinal cord

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy game show, with Sean Lock and Greg Davies taking on Jon Richardson and Holly Walsh. Susie Dent is joined by Vic Reeves in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson join forces with Jason Manford and Roisin Conaty respectively. Sam Simmons helps the show's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 68-year-old professional actor visits St George's Hospital after injuring his shoulder while rushing to catch a train, and a check-up indicates he may need corrective surgery to set things right, but further assessment suggests he might be living with a much more serious condition. An octogenarian couple are rushed in to A&E after being knocked over by a motorcyclist while crossing the road, and the police maintain an active presence as paramedics bring in a man who has collapsed after a suspected drug overdose. Plus, an 88-year-old woman with a swollen leg discusses her ill-fated marriage to a much younger man nearly four decades ago

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Tamsin is looking for her dream holiday home on the Greek island of Crete. She and her best friend Emma, who she has known since meeting at nursery school, have enjoyed many a holiday on the island, and now Tamsin is ready to have her own bolthole there. Laura Hamilton works within her budget of 100,000 to find a suitable property

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates shock reports that changing sea temperatures mean squid and chips could one day replace fish and chips as the UK's national dish, and heads to Thailand, where squid is a national obsession. Kate Quilton goes Down Under to find out about a surprising new meat coming into our supermarkets and Matt Tebbutt heads to Italy to find out how supermarkets can sell pesto at an affordable price when the traditional ingredients are famously expensive

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman shows London-based Sri Lankan couple Kulan and Kamala five properties for their budget of 200,000 in Portugal's Algarve region. However, it remains to be seen which property has the most 'wow' factor to become the accountants' dream holiday home

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Thomas and Doreen from Sunderland have been dreaming of owning a holiday home in Spain since their first anniversary there 39 years ago. Scarlette Douglas searches far and wide to find them the perfect property in eastern Andaluca for their 55,000 budget. But will it be a modern apartment near the sea or a traditional cave house in the countryside that wins their hearts?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mark and Maggie have been together for 35 years and are looking for a holiday home in Barbados, where they can escape British winters and make the most of the tropical climate. With a budget of 350,000, Jasmine Harman uses her extensive knowledge of the island to find the best properties for the pair to choose between

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples searching in Sheffield. Scientists Lois and Ahmed's strategic approach has so far seen them lose out on eight houses, being outbid by just a few thousand pounds each time. With a toddler in tow, and living with Lois's parents, the heat is on for Kirstie to find their own family home. Phil is with Liz and Luke, who are set on the rural areas around the city, close to the Peak District

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alex Sullivan hosts the first party in Chelmsford, Essex, hoping to impress with her birthday party-themed evening. However, an uncomfortable reunion between two former school friends gets the night off to a bad start, and a less than satisfactory dessert leaves the host with little to celebrate

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businessman Scott Johnson hosts an 'Essex Glam-themed' night for the second dinner party of the week in Chelmsford, Essex. His menu initially impresses his guests, until they realise he has taken some shortcuts with his preparations. However, a bigger problem emerges when former classmates John Mabey and Martin Young renew old hostilities, so Scott tries to lighten the mood by taking everyone for a dance in 'Essex's smallest disco' - his kitchen

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Deb Croghan hosts the third dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, and hopes to impress her guests with a tarts and vicars-style evening. Following an uncomfortable game of guessing everyone's age, she perks up the evening with an unusual entertainment - a cucumber-based sport she claims is a traditional family pastime

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Twenty-five-year-old hot-tub salesman John Mabey hosts the fourth dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, setting out to woo his guests with a Shakespearean evening featuring an Italian-style menu, but when his food comes close to a complete fiasco, he turns to theatrics to save the day - including asking his guests to act out Romeo and Juliet

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Martin Young hosts the final dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, hoping to impress his guests by throwing a Caribbean-themed evening. The diners are pleasantly surprised by the quality of his food and shocked when he reveals a secret talent, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Holland Hall Hotel in Upholland, Lancashire, where two of the guests are less than impressed when the breakfast table is laid with steak knives

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Railway Inn near Hull in East Yorkshire, where young couple Lydia Perkins and Luke Mainprize feel the pressure at breakfast time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Driftwood B&B in Weymouth, where guest Lygia prepares to party when she spies the host's disco balls

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the Bull Hotel in Wrotham, Kent, where owner Lygia Fontanella-Deadman prides herself on a luxury stay. But a surprise leads to criticism from one couple

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Genice and Cathy want Lydia and Luke to shed some light on the wardrobe situation

programme.title: Home Greek Home
programme.desc: Sarah Moore renovates a house on the Greek island of Skiathos after buying it without seeing it during lockdown. Having spent many years holidaying and working on the island, Sarah has developed a deep connection to Skiathos and has long dreamt of owning a house there. The family visit the house for the first time and learn about the complications that come with renovating a house in a country with different rules and regulations

programme.title: Amanda Owen's Farming Lives
programme.desc: Amanda visits Llyr Jones' hill farm in north Wales and learns how he has focused on making a profit and protecting the environment since taking over the farm as a teenager. She works alongside Vicky and Sian in the egg packing unit, on an early morning calf-feeding routine and rounding up sheep while taking a crash course in Welsh language sheep dog commands

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Zaki, 63, recently underwent a tonsillectomy following a diagnosis of throat cancer, but he has come to A&E after suffering a serious bleed. Doctors try to save 10-month-old baby Amy, who stopped breathing at home, while 21-year-old expectant father Craig appears to have had a miraculous escape after a motocross accident, but has he learnt his lesson?

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eighty-four-year-old Paula is referred to St George's for urgent treatment, after a routine blood test detected that she has a dangerously high level of potassium in her blood. Meanwhile, 74-year-old Derek is brought into A&E after suffering a suspected stroke. As he goes for emergency surgery, his devoted wife Mary is determined to help him recover. Plus, 31-year-old fireman Glenn arrives with a suspected abscess in his throat; he is joined by his twin brother Dean, and the pair prove to be inseparable

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Officers in Australia investigate a suspicious-looking car and intervene when a dog is reportedly locked inside a vehicle on a hot day in New South Wales.

programme.desc: Exploring a jungle refuge concealing a story of royal deceit, nuclear bunkers infiltrated by outsiders, and a haunted hospital marked by scandal

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a beachside resort with ties to the Russian mafia, a windswept base hiding lifesaving technology, and a site in Iowa plagued by its past

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Germany, learning about an Edwardian fitness craze in Dresden before heading to Leipzig on a historic line built by British engineers in 1839. He discovers model-railway making on the grandest of scales in Hamburg and ends his journey in Kiel, where he reveals how British yachtsmen spied on the German navy in the early 20th century

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores Scandinavia, braving one of the world's oldest rollercoasters in Copenhagen's Tivoli Gardens. He then crosses the Oresund Bridge linking Denmark to Sweden, retracing the journey of a train that carried a revolutionary Russian passenger on an epic voyage, before test-driving a vintage Volvo in Gothenburg. Crossing into Norway, Michael discovers how in 1913 the nation expressed its distinctively modern identity in plays, paintings and polar exploration

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Bohemia and Bavaria, beginning by exploring the art nouveau architecture of Czech Republic capital Prague. He then samples the sulphurous spa waters and wallows in peat and mud in Marianske Lazne, formerly known as Marienbad, before test driving a state-of-the-art passenger train made at the Skoda factory in Pilsen. Crossing the border into Germany, Michael encounters a fire-breathing dragon in Furth-im-Wald, and learns about an early 20th-century pioneer who laid the foundations for Munich's pre-eminence in science and technology

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets out to sample the delights of the Atlantic coasts of Spain and France, beginning in Bordeaux, where he uncovers a historic British connection to the region's wines. Across the border in San Sebastian, Michael learns how diplomacy brought Britain and Spain closer together and rides on a hair-raising scenic railway. Heading to Bilbao, he explores the industrial ties between France and Spain and learns to cook a traditional Basque dish

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures once more on to the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide, beginning by travelling through Russia. He starts in the industrial city of Tula, before visiting Leo Tolstoy's former home of Yasnaya Polyana and learning how the author's life and works were intertwined with the railways. Michael then boards the train that runs from the Caspian Sea to Moscow, where he performs an important role in a dramatic opera at the Bolshoi Theatre, before exploring the beauty and history of St Petersburg and riding on the first railway ever built in Russia

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Steered by his 1913 Bradshaw railway guide, Michael Portillo takes the train down the spine of Italy as he travels from Rome to Sicily. He begins by weaving among the capital city's landmarks on the back of a 1950s Vespa, before boarding the train south to Naples, where he finds out about the first railway to be built in the country, and ventures into the crater of Mount Vesuvius. He takes a detour to the island of Capri, before finishing his journey in the ancient hilltop town of Taormina

programme.desc: On the penultimate night in and around north London, insurance underwriter Fraser treats his guests to an Asian-inspired menu. There's a clash over cruises, stand-up surprises and a sunset singalong, but will Fraser's cooking be enough for him to grab the 1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in and around north London, public relations executive Melissa presents her menu of Greek Cypriot classics. After a week of shocking singing, bad piano playing and even worse impressions, it's up to Melissa to show that she has what it takes to win the 1,000 prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mark and Caroline want a bolthole on Spain's stunning Orihuela Costa that works for all the family and is close to the golf courses. Scarlette Douglas shows them what their 100,000 budget can secure

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Manjit and Cathy Jandu have recently retired from their medical practice and are ready for a new environment. Inspired by their son who lived in Madrid for a year, they've decided Spain is for them and are determined to buy a villa around Estepona on the Costa del Sol. With 300,000 to find the perfect property, Jonnie Irwin sets out to locate and show them five homes to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton searches for a retirement home on Spain's Costa de Almeria for Ted and Diane Brewer, who met on holiday 20 years ago and would now like to live in the sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Angie and Sandy Stanford-Barclay from Nottingham are approaching retirement and looking for a place where they can spend quality time together. They've decided the sunshine of the southern Costa Blanca is the perfect place to do just that, so Ben Hillman shows them five properties for their 75,000 budget

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In Bath, Kirstie Allsopp meets first time buyers Laura and Phil, who are desperate to make the move from shared living to a home of their own. Meanwhile, Phil Spencer goes property searching with downsizing duo Kerrie and Dave, who sold their beloved barn conversion to move closer to their kids

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps Jacinta and Marco, who have outgrown their home in Didsbury, Greater Manchester, while Phil Spencer assists newly engaged Olivia and Amy, who want to settle back in the North after five years on the move

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps a Cardiff couple with two teenage children to find a holiday home around Mijas on Spain's Costa del Sol, on a budget of 200,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: In and around Los Alczares on Spain's Costa Clida, Craig Rowe pulls out all the stops to find Diane and John from Derbyshire their dream holiday home. They've holidayed in this part of the world many times, and have decided that now is the right time to buy their very own property there. The pair have a maximum budget of 180,000 for Craig to work with

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil look back on some of their most interesting renovations and house-hunts, starting with Sophie and Paul in Aylesbury, who were divided over their three-bed house which Paul bought himself. After meeting Sophie and having two children together, Paul decided he wanted to move into a bigger and better family home while Sophie wanted to stay in the area with her family nearby. Amy and Louis in Cowbridge, Wales were in turmoil over their period home which Louis had inherited from his late grandmother. The house held many memories for Louis but with his recent diagnosis and the upkeep required, Amy doubted it could be a long-term home for them

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets master carpenter Olaf, who is facing the biggest challenge of his career - creating an oasis for himself and partner Fritha on a small slice of land in West Sussex, which happens to be surrounded by a mainline railway and a busy A-road. Not only that, but half of the plot can't even be built on due an underground mains sewer. All they're left with is a very small triangle on which to build their future life together. With 190,000 in the bank, Olaf and Fritha must use all the ingenuity they can muster to make their triangular three-bedroom house come to life

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz as Richard Ayoade and Sara Pascoe take on Jon Richardson and Chris McCausland. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate, aided by Morgana Robinson in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Following three patients who have adapted to the challenges thrown their way, including 27-year-old Josh, who was rushed to A&E after being thrown from his motorbike at speed. Georgie has brought in her 10-month-old son Phoenix after she caught him sucking on a bleach tablet, while 21-year-old Ross is in A&E after dislocating his shoulder at work

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 56-year-old woman is rushed to St George's with an open ankle fracture after falling in her garden, and a man suffering chest pains looks back on his career on the railway, which was cut short by a leg amputation. An 84-year-old man collapses at home following a bout of dizziness, and his children reflect on the challenges of watching his health decline in recent years

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc: Alice Levine continues to explore the sex lives of others, discovering out-of-the-ordinary love stories from across the world. In this first episode, she dives into new, advanced technologies that could be what sex and relationships will look like in the future, meeting a couple in Berlin who opened the world's first cyber-brothel, populated by talking sex dolls. She heads to Las Vegas to witness the next generation of sex-robots and also meets a couple whose relationship exists in a virtual 'furry' universe, but who are about to risk it all, taking their love affair offline and moving across the world to be together IRL (In Real Life)

programme.title: Send Nudes: Body SOS
programme.desc: Using ground-breaking technology, individuals considering cosmetic surgery get to see themselves like they have never seen before through full-size avatars of their naked bodies. In the opening episode, Vogue Williams meets chiselled carpenter Steven, who wants a porn star-sized penis, and single mum Steph, who is desperate for smaller boobs. But as they both confront their life-size naked avatars, will they decide to push ahead with their plans for surgery or will their minds be changed by what they see in front of them?

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc: Guy investigates the future of energy production, travelling to Orkney to look at how the Scottish islands are at the forefront of hydrogen research. He also joins the workforce at Europe's biggest building site and the Hinkley Point C nuclear power station, finding out why reactors are so expensive and take 10 years to build, and works inside Britain's most toxic site - handling nuclear waste inside the Sellafield facility

programme.title: Devon and Cornwall
programme.desc: In the fold of the foothills of Exmoor, Devon farmers Rob and Sarah Taylor prepare their native ponies for the show season, but first they need to round them up from off the moor. At the southern tip of Cornwall, the South West Coastal Path is under threat of erosion from the thousands of footsteps veering off the marked track each year

programme.desc: Officers follow a stolen BMW fitted with a tracking device as it heads for a cargo ship, while a drunk driver is pursued through Epping Forest. Documentary series profiling the work of a high-speed police interception unit in Essex

programme.desc: Gibbs and the team set up a stake-out at a storage facility to catch a thief suspected of selling hi-tech Navy equipment on the black market, but end up witnessing a murder. To make matters worse, $90million worth of radar gear goes missing while they are distracted. Meanwhile, Ducky asks Abby to run a series of mysterious blood tests, raising suspicions that he is harbouring a secret

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A suspect in a drug-smuggling case is seemingly mauled to death by his own dog, which is immediately scheduled to be destroyed - but Abby refuses to hand it over to Navy officials and launches her own investigation. Meanwhile, Gibbs continues to worry about Shepard's health, convinced she and Ducky are hiding something. Drama, starring Pauley Perrette, Mark Harmon and Lauren Holly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents are investigated by the FBI on suspicion of murdering arms dealer La Grenouille. Jenny Shepard is the prime suspect, as she believed the criminal killed her father some years earlier, so Gibbs forms a plan to help his boss. However, an eyewitness later comes forward and implicates Tony. Starring Lauren Holly and Mark Harmon

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A convicted contract killer agrees to show Danny where he dumped the bodies of a series of homicide victims in exchange for a more lenient sentence for his son, who is facing grand theft larceny charges. Jamie goes undercover in one of the Sanfino family's criminal organisations, while Erin looks into the past of her enigmatic new friend Jacob Krystal

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A wealthy philanthropist who was accused of rape and kidnap is killed. A former supermodel whose daughter was attacked is blamed for the murder - but Benson is alarmed to find herself implicated by the defendant's wily attorney. Jacqueline Bisset guest stars alongside Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A serial rapist represents himself in court and is released on bail, despite his first victim picking him out during an identity parade. Benson and Stabler refuse to give up the chase, but the criminal strikes again, and this time the result is murder. Fred Savage guest stars alongside Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A waitress is found raped and murdered outside a nightclub, with suspicion falling on her ex-boyfriend. However, the detectives get a new lead when they discover the victim was in an abusive love affair with her boss, while news of her treatment is mistakenly leaked to her father - who vows to take revenge on the attacker. Joe Morton (Law & Order) guest stars, alongside Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A 14-year-old girl is found murdered, and as detectives investigate the case, it is revealed she is involved in the same charitable foundation as four abduction victims. The scheme is run by a prominent physician who specialises in hormone replacement and perpetuating youth. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: Liz realises she is being framed by the Cabal and must rely on Red's connections to prove her innocence, all the while moving closer to uncovering her true family history. Cooper is taken aback by some shocking news, and Ressler, Samar and Aram must work out who they can trust. Drama, starring Megan Boone and James Spader

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: The FBI descends into a panic over a plot to cripple the American economy, and as the nation faces the prospect of total collapse, Red and Liz try to catch one of the most fearsome names on the blacklist. Meanwhile, Liz's hands are also full caring for a sick loved one. Drama, starring James Spader

Ducky conducts an autopsy and makes a discovery that sets the agents off in search of a missing infant. Meanwhile, Tony is distracted by developments in his relationship with Jeanne

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Assistant coroner Palmer is called to the building site on a Navy base where a body has been found. While looking into the incident, he spots an armed man fleeing the scene with the victim's passport and is almost killed as he gives chase. It appears the document was stolen to hinder the investigation, but the discovery of a second corpse reveals a case of stolen identity and a compensation racket

programme.title: NCIS

Jenny Shepard calls in Mike Franks for help, afraid she too is a target - and convinced Gibbs will be next. American crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series focuses on Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: Captain Janeway is haunted by a succession of recurring images from an unpleasant experience on the holodeck. Starring Kate Mulgrew and Robert Picardo

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A petty officer arriving at airport security dies during a random search. Conducting an autopsy on the body, Dr Wade suspects that he died from natural causes. However, just as she is concluding her examination, a man enters the morgue, demanding to take the deceased back to his family. After Wade refuses, he pulls a gun and holds her, Sebastian Lund and Danny Malloy hostage. Drama, starring CCH Pounder, Scott Bakula and Lucas Black

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: Deacon's family gets caught in the crosshairs of a drug cartel when he and the team aim to bring down its leader, who is running narcotics in plain sight via a flower market. programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: A woman is struck by a car while suffering terrifying hallucinations. Though seriously injured she survives the accident, but during the commotion an unidentified man arrives on the scene and strangles her. Nick and Hank investigate, and discover a goat-like creature that could be behind a series of recent disappearances

programme.title: EFL Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Liverpool v Cardiff City. Action from the 20212 final at Wembley Stadium. The Reds had defeated the likes of Stoke City, Chelsea and Manchester City to reach the final and went into the match as clear favourites in their first visit to the national stadium since it was rebuilt. However, the Bluebirds, who defeated Crystal Palace on penalties in the semi-finals, had been in good form in the Championship and will have fancied their chances of producing an upset
